sect1.title: The Systemd boot loader
sect1.para: This documentation is for yast2-bootloader and applies to systemd-boot.
The general structure of the &ay; boot loader part looks like the following:
sect1.screen: <bootloader> <loader_type> systemd-boot </loader_type> <global> <!-- entries defining the installation settings for systemd-boot and the generic boot code --> </global> </bootloader>

sect2.title: Loader type
sect2.para: This defines which boot loader (systemd-boot) to use. Not all architectures support both legacy and EFI variants of the boot loader.

sect2.title: Globals
sect2.para: This is an important if optional part. Define here where to install systemd-boot and how the boot process will work. yast2-bootloader proposes a configuration if you do not define one. Unless you have some special requirements, do not specify the boot loader configuration in the XML file.

listitem.para: If set to false, then UEFI secure boot is disabled.
The timeout in seconds until the default boot entry is booted automatically.
